Authors: Enrico Ercole, Heidi Tamm, Alfredo Vizzini
Title:
Study and clarification of Peziza petersii and P. proteana
(Ascomycota, Pezizales, Pezizaceae), and the status of thecabbage-head
fungus (P. proteana f. sparassoides)
Keywords:
Pezizomycetes, Peziza lobulata, P. proteana f. proteana,
P. proteana f. sparassoides, Underwoodia campbellii, ITS rDNA and RPB2
sequences, Morphology, Taxonomy.
Abstract:
Amongst the twisted group of Peziza with
blue-violet-purplish hymenial surface, P. petersii P. proteana
f. proteana and f. sparassoides were studied using both morphological
and molecular approaches. Our analyses showed that: i) the first two
taxa have to be considered a single species, and since P. petersii Berk.
was published in 1875 and Aleuria proteana Boud. in 1899, the prioritary
name is the former; P. proteana f. sparassoides (Boud.) Korf is a
distinct evolutive line it is here recognized at species level using the
older disposable species name that is Underwoodia campbellii Sacc. 1909.
Consequently, Peziza campbellii nov. comb. is introduced.
